0                                  15092              ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   15093              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   15094              Ÿ  SAMPARMS -- Routine to get and save parameters returned by         Ÿ
                                   15095              Ÿ    Samson.                                                          Ÿ
                                   15096              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   15097              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   15098              Ÿ      R0 - 0 = don't set time/date                                   Ÿ
                                   15099              Ÿ           1 = set the time/date                                     Ÿ
                                   15100              Ÿ      FFINFO dsect contains information about the file               Ÿ
                                   15101              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   15102              Ÿ    On exit, R15 (and cc):                                           Ÿ
                                   15103              Ÿ      0 - opened successfully                                        Ÿ
                                   15104              Ÿ      4 - not opened (CPERRID contains error id)                     Ÿ
                                   15105              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  15572                       ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   15573                       Ÿ  It is possible that the user has done a "SET TERMINAL      Ÿ
                                   15574                       Ÿ    SAMSON" on a non-Samson terminal.  In this case we will  Ÿ
                                   15575                       Ÿ    get a packet send error here.  The logic is to then      Ÿ
                                   15576                       Ÿ    try sending a path close which presumably will fail      Ÿ
                                   15577                       Ÿ    also.  If for some reason the path close works, then we  Ÿ
                                   15578                       Ÿ    will retry the path open.                                Ÿ
                                   15579                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
 001A54 4780 7148            01A9C 15580                       IF    NZ,BEGIN            Packet send error...
 001A58 41F0 00C8            000C8 15591  1                      LA    R15,200             Wait 2 second without reading
 001A5C 58E0 7680/0DEE       01FD4 15592  1                      VCALL WAITER              Sit it out
                                   15596  1
 001A62 D201 6124 76D4 00124 02028 15597  1                      MVC   SAMSCMD,=C'PC'      Path close
 001A68 58E0 7674/0DEE       01FC8 15598  1                      ACALL SEGHEAD             Seg packet header
 001A6E 58E0 7678/0DEE       01FCC 15602  1                      ACALL SEGTRAIL            Seg packet trailer
 001A74 1B00/41F0 60E8_            15606  1                      SEGWR ,                   Try sending the path close
                                   15630  1
 001A80 D201 BA98 5008 00A98 00008 15631  1                      MVC   CPSAMTMO,SAMPSTM    Restore timeout value
 001A86 94EF 6005      00005       15632  1                      CLEAR SAMFNORETRY         Clear no retry flag
                                   15639  1
 001A8A 12FF/4770 7140             15640  1                      IF    (R15,Z),BEGIN       Hmm, this time SEGWR worked...
 001A90 4640 70CA            01A1E 15654  2                        BCT   R4,SAMPLOOP         Go back and try it again
                                   15655  2           *  If we fall through then it means that we give up.
 001A94                            15656  1                      END
                                   15660  1
 001A94 41F0 0004            00004 15661  1                      LA    R15,4               Bad return code
 001A98 47F0 75D4            01F28 15662  1                      B     SAMPDONE            Scram
 001A9C                            15663                       END
                                   15667
 001A9C D201 BA98 5008 00A98 00008 15668                       MVC   CPSAMTMO,SAMPSTM    Restore timeout value
 001AA2 94EF 6005      00005       15669                       CLEAR SAMFNORETRY         Clear no retry flag
                                   15676                       ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   15677                       Ÿ  Now send path parameters packet.  Ÿ
                                   15678                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
 001AA6 D201 6124 76D6 00124 0202A 15679                       MVC   SAMSCMD,=C'PP'      Path parameters
 001AAC 58E0 7674/0DEE       01FC8 15680                       ACALL SEGHEAD             Seg packet header

                                   15688

                                   15737                       Ÿ  Process path parameter information which was returned.  Ÿ
                                   15738                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  24123                       ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   24124                       Ÿ  For "fast ftp" connections the data is sent over a        Ÿ
                                   24125                       Ÿ    separate direct TCP connection.  In the read/write      Ÿ
                                   24126                       Ÿ    parameters Samson returns, Samson tells us that it can  Ÿ
                                   24127                       Ÿ    accept a "fast ftp" connection.  We then open the TCP   Ÿ
                                   24128                       Ÿ    connection and wait for Samson to open it's side.       Ÿ
                                   24129                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
 00398E 9120 6004/47E0_00004       24130                       IF    SAMFFAST,BEGIN      Open fast ftp connection...
 003996 58E0 7D50/0DEE       04338 24145  1                      ACALL SNETOPEN            Open connection
 00399C 4770 73C2            039AA 24149  1                      BNZ   SAMOEXIT            Trouble, scram
 0039A0                            24150                       END
                                   24154                       ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   24155                       Ÿ  Normal open completion.  Ÿ
                                   24156                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   26583              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   26584              Ÿ  SAMREAD -- Routine to read the next line from a Samson file.       Ÿ
                                   26585              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   26586              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   26587              Ÿ      R1,R0 - loc, len of line area                                  Ÿ
                                   26588              Ÿ      Device work area - file info ..                                Ÿ
                                   26589              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   26590              Ÿ    On exit:                                                         Ÿ
                                   26591              Ÿ      R1, R0 - loc len of text                                       Ÿ
                                   26592              Ÿ      R2 - line number                                               Ÿ
                                   26593              Ÿ      R15=ZERO, line returned.  R15=NZ, end of file.                 Ÿ
                                   26594              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  27726  1                      ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   27727  1                      Ÿ  This is a little tricky:                                     Ÿ
                                   27728  1                      Ÿ                                                               Ÿ
                                   27729  1                      Ÿ  If the first character is an "@" then the data is in ASCII,  Ÿ
                                   27730  1                      Ÿ     and if the first character is a "|" then it is in         Ÿ
                                   27731  1                      Ÿ     EBCDIC.                                                   Ÿ
                                   27732  1                      Ÿ                                                               Ÿ
                                   27733  1                      Ÿ  For the Macintosh, if the first character is X'2D' then      Ÿ
                                   27734  1                      Ÿ    the data is in ASCII, and if the first character is a "-"  Ÿ
                                   27735  1                      Ÿ    then it is in EBCDIC.                                      Ÿ
                                   27736  1                      Ÿ                                                               Ÿ
                                   27737  1                      Ÿ  We want it in EBCDIC so that it can later be translated to   Ÿ
                                   27738  1                      Ÿ    ASCII by the seg routines.                                 Ÿ
                                   27739  1                      Ÿ                                                               Ÿ
                                   27740  1                      Ÿ  A key factor here is that our ASCII to EBCDIC tables         Ÿ
                                   27741  1                      Ÿ    provide a 1-to-1 translation.                              Ÿ
                                   27742  1                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
 004718 957C 4000/4780_00000       27743  1                      IF    ((@R4,EQ,'@'),OR,(@R4,EQ,X'2D')),BEGIN  ASCII...
 004728 58E0 796E/0DEE       04EC0 27774  2                        VCALL TOEBCDIC            If ASCII, convert
 00472E                            27778  1                      END
                                   27782  1                     ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   27783  1                     Ÿ  Compatability note:  Samson file transfer protocol version 1  Ÿ
                                   27784  1                     Ÿ    expected the "guard" characters to be present in the data   Ÿ
                                   27785  1                     Ÿ    that was transferred down and also line separators between  Ÿ
                                   27786  1                     Ÿ    each line.                                                  Ÿ
                                   27787  1                     ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»
 00472E D501 79BA BA94_04F0C 00A94 27788  1                      IF    (CPSAMPRO,LT,2),BEGIN  Version 1...
 004738 1814/1803/41F0_            27806  2                        SEG   (R4),(R3)           Write data
 004746 9640 60DE      000DE       27831  2                        SET   SAMFCTRL
 00474A 4110 79BC/4100_      04F0E 27837  2                        SEG   '\;'                Hard CR
 00475C 94BF 60DE      000DE       27854  2                        CLEAR SAMFCTRL
 004760                            27861  1                      END
                                   27865  1
 004760 7212/47F0 7228 04760 04736 27866  1                      ELSE  BEGIN               Version 2 and above...
 004764 4140 4001            00001 27877  2                        LA    R4,@R4+1            Skip over leading guard char
 004768 4B30 79BE            04F10 27878  2                        SH    R3,=H'2'            Adjust length so no trailing
 00476C 1814/1803/41F0_            27879  2                        SEG   (R4),(R3)           Just the data
 00477A                            27904  1                      END
                                   27908  1                      ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   27909  1                      Ÿ  Write current packet out if it is too large.  Ÿ
                                   27910  1                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

0                                  30300              *
                                   30301              *  RESOLVE SAMSON NAME
                                   30302              *
                                   30303              *  PROCESS FILE NAME IN FFNAME IN FFINFO DSECT
                                   30304              *  WE HAVE A FEW SIMPLE RULES (COMPARED TO IBM FILES):
                                   30305              *    IF QUOTED, WE UNQUOTE.
                                   30306              *    IF '*', WE EXPAND.
                                   30307              *    IF VOLUME NAME IN FFHOST, PREPEND TO FILE NAME.
                                   30308              *
                                   30309              *  NOTE:
                                   30310              *  CANONICAL FILE SAMSON FILE NAME INCLUDES <VOL>: PREFIX.
                                   30311              *
                                   30312              *  NOTE/CAUTION:
                                   30313              *  'C:*' AND '* ON C' ARE NOT VALID FILE NAMES.
                                   30314              *
 000000                00000 00110 30315              SMRWA    RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            30323  1           SMRNAME    DS    XL(L'FFHOST+L'FFNAME+16)
 000110                00110 00110 30324                       END
                                   30333              *
                                   30334              *
 004FB2 50E0 D000/9008_      00000 30335              SAMRESLV XPROC SMRWA
 USING  *,R7
 USING  SMRWA-(4+36),R8
 004FCC 1861                       30386                       LR    R6,R1
 USING  FFINFO,R6                  30387                       WITH  (FFINFO,R6)
                                   30400
                                   30401                       COMMENT                   NORMAL RESOLVED NAME IS FNAME
 004FCE 5820 6008            00008 30402                       L     R2,FFNAMEL
 004FD2 5020 6214            00214 30403                       ST    R2,FFRNAMEL
 004FD6 0620/1222/4740_            30404                       MOVE  R2,FFRNAME,FFNAME
                                   30442
                                   30443                       COMMENT                   IF VOLUME, PREPEND
                                   30444                       COMMENT ,                  (E.G. C:FILENAME)
 004FE2 D603 608C 608C_0008C 0008C 30445                       IF    (FFHOSTL,NZ),BEGIN
 004FEC 4110 8028            00000 30461  1                      LA    R1,SMRNAME          BUILD NAME IN SMRNAME
 004FF0 5820 608C            0008C 30462  1                      L     R2,FFHOSTL
 004FF4 0620/1222/4740_            30463  1                      MOVE  R2,@R1,FFHOST
 005000 5A10 608C            0008C 30501  1                      A     R1,FFHOSTL
 005004 927A 1000      00000       30502  1                      MVI   @R1,C':'
 005008 5E10 7A9C            05A68 30503  1                      INCR  R1
 00500C 5820 6008            00008 30506  1                      L     R2,FFNAMEL
 005010 0620/1222/4740_            30507  1                      MOVE  R2,@R1,FFNAME
 00501C 5820 608C            0008C 30545  1                      L     R2,FFHOSTL          CALC NEW NAME LENGTH
 005020 5A20 6008            00008 30546  1                      A     R2,FFNAMEL
 005024 5E20 7A9C            05A68 30547  1                      INCR  R2
 005028 5920 7AA0/47D0_      05A6C 30550  1                      CEIL  R2,L'FFRNAME
 005034 5020 6214            00214 30569  1                      ST    R2,FFRNAMEL         MOVE NAME INTO FFRNAME
 005038 0620/1222/4740_            30570  1                      MOVE  R2,FFRNAME,SMRNAME
 005044                            30608                       END
                                   30612
                                   30613                       COMMENT                   IF *, EXPAND FILE NAME, AND
                                   30614                       COMMENT                     HOST NAME TOO IF NEEDED
 005044 4110 600C/5800_      0000C 30615                       SETMSG FFNAME,L:FFNAMEL
 00504C 5900 7A9C/4770_      05A68 30629                       IF    ((R0,EQ,1),AND,(@R1,EQ,'*')),BEGIN

                                   30854              *  SET FNAME
                                   30855              *
                                   30856              *  USE RESOLVED FILE NAME. SET VALUE IN SAMWA DSECT.
                                   30857              *
                                   30858              *  NOTE/CAUTION !
                                   30859              *  SET FNAME USES RESOLVED FORM OF SAM FILE NAME SO
                                   30860              *  NAME RESOLVE MUST BE CALLED PRIOR TO THIS CALL.
                                   30861              *  WOULD IT NOT BE BETTER JUST TO ISSUE NRESOLVE CALL
                                   30862              *  FROM THIS ROUTINE.  BE BETTER TO BUNDLE THEM UP
                                   30863              *  TOGETHER. ??

                                   30865              *

                                   32388                       Ÿ    check).                                               Ÿ
                                   32389                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   32440                       Ÿ  Add the new data line to the seg buffer.  The seg  Ÿ
                                   32441                       Ÿ    routines will automatically write the buffer if  Ÿ

                                   44025              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   44026              Ÿ  CHECKCRC -- Local routine to perform a 16-bit polynomial           Ÿ
                                   44027              Ÿ    cyclic redundancy check.  (This is supposed to be a              Ÿ
                                   44028              Ÿ    "standard CRC-16" calculation, those who are really curious      Ÿ
                                   44029              Ÿ    about this code should talk with Mike Durket.)                   Ÿ
                                   44030              Ÿ                                                                     Ÿ
                                   44031              Ÿ    On entry:                                                        Ÿ
                                   44032              Ÿ      R15 - old CRC                                                  Ÿ

                                   44080                       Ÿ  Calculate CRC from data.  Ÿ
                                   44081                       ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   44098  1                      ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   44099  1                      Ÿ  Step 1:                                                   Ÿ
                                   44100  1                      Ÿ    Exclusive-OR the input byte with the low-order byte of  Ÿ
                                   44101  1                      Ÿ    the old CRC to get X.                                   Ÿ
                                   44102  1                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

 00791C 1725                       44104  1                      XR    R2,R5               Exclusive or with old CRC
 00791E 5420 7398            07CA8 44105  1                      N     R2,=A(X'FF')        Only keep low byte of R2
                                   44106  1                      ¿þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþÜ
                                   44107  1                      Ÿ  Step 2:                                          Ÿ
                                   44108  1                      Ÿ    Shift the old CRC eight bits to the right.     Ÿ
                                   44109  1                      Ÿ    Note:  This shift is logical, not arithmetic.  Ÿ
                                   44110  1                      ¾þþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþþ»

                                   44233              *  THIS IS THE SAME AS LRTRIM, EXCEPT IT ALSO TRIMS
                                   44234              *  LEADING '=' TOO.

 007C84 0600                       44324  1                      DECR  R0
